intro: Strobilanthes viscosa, commonly known as the sticky strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that give it a sticky texture. The plant produces showy, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
